The application installs easily in a minimum number of steps
The installation of application is self explanatory, in case it needs assistance then Installation Guideline is provided.
Installation guideline goes step by step, in exact way application has to be installed, giving the action by the person doing installation.
If the application uses a disk cache, it also registers with the Disk Cleanup utility.
The application does not install icons to the Windows desktop without the user's permission.
The application works correctly if the user increases the size of the default font.
The application's uninstall process leaves no remaining files or registry entries other than files created by the user.
The application has its own database connection user id and password for security purpose.
The database connection string, user id, password and other connection details are configurable.
Back end jobs are installed with minimum number of steps.
Schedulers are installed with minimum number of steps. If many schedulers are involved, then installation of these is automated.
Interface with other applications are automated, they don't require manual intervention for communicating to each other.
Master data are configurable using Admin options to the extent possible.

XML and other file inputs are in application specific folder, created during installation, not manual creation. If this file input is from another application/interface, then the path is configurable.
User-generated data files are stored by default in the My Documents folder or a specific folder within application folder which need not be created by user manually.
The application does not write files to the root of the hard disk.
Mail server configuration doesn't require code change, it is configurable externally.
If the application is highly database driven, then stored procedures are used for communicating to database.
The installation guideline provides the Hardware/Software specifications as per requirement.
The required supporting DLLs are installed along with main, single installable.
The stored procedures are installed along with database using specific database server restore command/s with minimal steps.

Â Backup schedule is timely and regular.
Â Every backup run is tested for its ability to restore the data accurately.
Â Backup media are physically secured.

If using Digital Certificates, test the browser Cache by enrolling for the Certificate and Completing all of the required security information. After completing the application and installation of the certificate, try using the <-- Backspace key to see if that security information is still residing in Cache. Have you defined standards for response time (i.e. all screens should paint within 10 seconds)?
Does the system operate in the same way across different computer and network configurations, platforms and environments, with different mixes of other applications
Does a new version of the software adversely affect response time and throughput?(Regression)
For lower volumes of database check for the system response when there is minimum data in the database. On lower volumes the system should have a faster response.
Do timeouts occur? This might lead to failures
Does the system slow down too much?
Are data lost or written without warning?
Can the site sustain long periods of usage by multiple users?
Can the site sustain long periods of continuous usage by 1 user?
Is page loading performance acceptable over modems of different speeds?
How reliable is the system under heavy work load?(Reliability)
Is the system scalable so that it can be upgraded in the future to accommodate the projected growth, without creating per item processing costs?
To check whether the system can handle the gradual increase in volume of data, by keeping the load (no of users) constant.
Will the site allow for large orders without locking out inventory if the transaction is invalid?
Can the site sustain large transactions without crashing?
Is the system is run with maximum amounts of data?
